Section_Description: Use these flags to control whether a product is discoverable and/or purchasable inside ChatGPT. These fields do not affect how the product is displayed on your own site they simply enable or disable the ChatGPT integrations.
Description: Controls whether the product can be surfaced in ChatGPT search results.
Allows direct purchase inside ChatGPT. enable_search must be true in order for enable_checkout to be enabled for the product.

Section_Description: Provide the core identifiers and descriptive text needed to uniquely reference each product. These fields establish the canonical record that ChatGPT Search uses to display and link to your product.
Validation_Rules: Max 100 chars; must remain stable over time

Example: Waterproof trail shoe with cushioned sole…

Validation_Rules: Must resolve with HTTP 200; HTTPS preferred

Section_Description: Capture the physical characteristics and classification details of the product. This data helps ensure accurate categorization filtering and search relevance.
Requirement: Required if product condition differs from new
Required for all excluding movies books and musical recording brands

Dependencies: Provide all three if using individual fields
Provide all three if using individual fields
Provide all three if using individual fields

Section_Description: Supply visual and rich media assets that represent the product. High-quality images and optional videos or 3D models improve user trust and engagement.
Define standard and promotional pricing information. These attributes power price display discount messaging and offer comparisons.
Describe current stock levels and key timing signals for product availability. Accurate inventory data ensures users only see items they can actually purchase.

Specify variant relationships and distinguishing attributes such as color or size. These fields allow ChatGPT to group related SKUs and surface variant-specific details. The item_group_id value should represent how the product is presented on the merchant's website. If you are submitting variant rows you must include the same item_group_id for every variant.
Outline shipping methods costs and estimated delivery times. Providing detailed shipping information helps users understand fulfillment options upfront.
Validation_Rules: Multiple entries allowed; use colon separators

Section_Description: Identify the seller and link to any relevant merchant policies or storefront pages. This ensures proper attribution and enables users to review seller credentials.
Provide return policies and time windows to set clear expectations for buyers. Transparent return data builds trust and reduces post-purchase confusion.
Share popularity and return-rate metrics where available. These signals can be used to enhance ranking and highlight high-performing products.
Include regulatory warnings disclaimers or age restrictions. Compliance fields help meet legal obligations and protect consumers.
Example: Contains lithium battery, or CA Prop 65 warning

Section_Description: Supply aggregated review statistics and frequently asked questions. User-generated insights strengthen credibility and help shoppers make informed decisions.

Example: Q: Is this waterproof? A: Yes

Section_Description: List products that are commonly bought together or act as substitutes. This enables basket-building recommendations and cross-sell opportunities.

Supported_Values: part_of_set, required_part, often_bought_with, substitute, different_brand, accessory

Section_Description: Indicate any region-specific pricing or availability overrides. Geo data allows ChatGPT to present accurate offers and stock status by location.

Validation_Rules: Regions must be valid ISO 3166 codes
